name: cosmetically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that relates to the way something looks: Cosmetically, the town is much improved since I last visited. We did the place up cosmetically to rent it out.
in a way that uses substances or treatments that are intended to improve your appearance: Her nose and jawline have been cosmetically altered. Botox is now used cosmetically to reduce wrinkles.
More examplesFewer examplesRegardless of how cosmetically nice the hotel looks, if the guests don’t have a comfortable experience, they won’t come back.You don't need every detail cosmetically perfect in your own home.Such a deformity can be very cosmetically displeasing to the patient.She wears her blond hair swept back from her cosmetically lifted face.Every part of her has been cosmetically enhanced.
